definition: military horse/by extension, military matters
generic term for weapons (old)/army (matters)/military affairs
surname Rong
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
army life (idiom)/the experience of war

sentences.english: Wu, poisson if poor if dead stream, deer, turn die alone between military ravines occasion.
sentences.chinese: 兀若枯木，泊若窮流，鹿獨戎馬之間，轉死溝壑之際。

sentences.english: Military hero of heart, beloved daughter.
sentences.chinese: 關山戎馬英雄心，魂牽夢縈女兒情。

sentences.english: The terracotta warriors were found in 1974 near Xi'an.
sentences.chinese: 戎馬俑1974年在西安相近被發現。

sentences.english: He was destined for a military career, like his father before him.
sentences.chinese: 他命中註定要步父親的後塵，過戎馬生涯。

sentences.english: Our recent adventures have disgusted me with military life.
sentences.chinese: 我們近來的冒險使我對戎馬生涯感到厭倦。

definition: to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to resign a government post
to die in battle (idiom)
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
isolated/solitary
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to depart this life/to be no more
fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
beautiful women suffer unhappy fates (idiom)
glorious achievement (idiom)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
talented field commander (military)
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
